Headline: #47 47th Temporary Eastbound Reroute near 47th/Prairie
ShortDescription: Eastbound #47 buses are temporarily rerouted via 47th, Indiana, 43rd, King Drive, and 47th, due to construction near 47th/Prairie.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
Eastbound #47 buses are temporarily rerouted via 47th, Indiana, 43rd, King Drive, and 47th, due to construction near 47th/Prairie.

Westbound buses are not affected.

Allow extra travel time.

Headline: Loop-bound Orange Line Service Delayed at Washington/Wells
ShortDescription: Loop-bound Orange Line trains continues to stand at Washington/Wells due to a police investigation. Crews working to restore service.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
Loop-bound Orange Line trains continues to stand at Washington/Wells due to a police investigation. 

As a result of the delayed train, Orange Line and Purple Line Express trains will be rerouted to the outer Loop (trains will board and exit on the Brown Line platforms at Washington/Wells, Quincy/Wells, LaSalle/Van Buren, State/Van Buren, Adams/Wabash, Washington/Wabash, State/Lake and Clark/Lake).

At this time, also consider other service alternatives that may serve your trip, such as nearby bus routes, or using buses to other rail lines. These May include:

  • #J14 Jeffrey Jump
  • #20 Madison
  • #22 Clark
  • #29 State
  • #36 Broadway
  • #56 Milwaukee
  • #60 Blue Island/26th
  • #62 Archer
  • #124 Navy Pier
  • Red Line, Blue Line and Green Line 'L' trains

Personnel are working to restore service. Allow extra travel time.

Headline: Service Between 54th/Cermak and Polk, then Racine (Blue Line) Stations, Only
ShortDescription: Pink Line service is still temporarily suspended between Polk and the Loop due a police investigation at Washington/Wells.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
Pink Line service is still temporarily suspended between Polk and the Loop due a police investigation at Washington/Wells.

As a result, Pink Line trains are running as follows:

  • Between 54th/Cermak and Polk, and then are diverted to Racine on the Blue Line for direct connections at Racine to continuing Blue Line train service to/from downtown.

Using connecting Blue Line service:

  • For service to downtown from Pink Line stations between 54th/Cermak and Polk, take a Pink Line train toward the Loop and stay on board until the train reaches Racine on the Blue Line. Transfer to an O'Hare-bound Blue Line train from the same platform for service into downtown.

  • For service from downtown to Pink Line stations between Polk and 54th/Cermak, take a Blue Line train toward Forest Park to Racine. Stay on the same platform side and wait for a 54th/Cermak-bound Pink Line train.

Shuttle buses are also available between Polk and Ashland to provide connections to continuing Green Line service.

Other possible alternatives may include: 

  • #9 Ashland
  • #21 Cermak
  • #49 Western
  • #50 Damen
  • #52 Kedzie/California
  • #53 Pulaski
  • #54 Cicero
  • #60 Blue Island-26th
  • #82 Kimball-Homan
  • #94 South California
  • #157 Streeterville-Taylor buses

...including to/from and in combination with other 'L' services.

Note that if you take a bus to/from the Pink Line, you may also be able to connect to/from the Blue Line's Forest Park branch or Green Line along Lake Street directly via that bus route.

See station personnel for further assistance, and pay attention to announcements on trains and at stations for service information.

We are working to restore service as quickly as possible. Allow extra travel time.
